verses.kjv: Hold not thy peace, O God of my praise;
verses.ct: God, the one I praise, don't stay silent!

verses.kjv: For the mouth of the wicked and the mouth of the deceitful are opened against me: they have spoken against me with a lying tongue.
verses.ct: Wicked and deceitful people have opened their mouths against me; they have told lies about me.

verses.kjv: They compassed me about also with words of hatred; and fought against me without a cause.
verses.ct: They have surrounded me with hateful words and attacked me for no reason.

verses.kjv: For my love they are my adversaries: but I give myself unto prayer.
verses.ct: In return for my love, they treat me as an enemy — but I keep praying.

verses.kjv: And they have rewarded me evil for good, and hatred for my love.
verses.ct: They have repaid my kindness with evil and given me hatred in exchange for my love.

verses.kjv: Set thou a wicked man over him: and let Satan stand at his right hand.
verses.ct: Appoint a wicked person to rule over him, and let an accuser stand at his right side.

verses.kjv: When he shall be judged, let him be condemned: and let his prayer become sin.
verses.ct: When he is put on trial, let him be found guilty, and let even his prayers count against him as sin.

verses.kjv: Let his days be few; and let another take his office.
verses.ct: Let his life be cut short, and let someone else take his position.

verses.kjv: Let his children be fatherless, and his wife a widow.
verses.ct: Let his children lose their father, and let his wife become a widow.

verses.kjv: Let his children be continually vagabonds, and beg: let them seek their bread also out of their desolate places.
verses.ct: Let his children wander as homeless beggars, searching for food far from their ruined homes.

verses.kjv: Let the extortioner catch all that he hath; and let the strangers spoil his labour.
verses.ct: Let creditors seize everything he owns, and let strangers plunder what he worked for.

verses.kjv: Let there be none to extend mercy unto him: neither let there be any to favour his fatherless children.
verses.ct: Let no one show him kindness, and let no one have compassion on his fatherless children.

verses.kjv: Let his posterity be cut off; and in the generation following let their name be blotted out.
verses.ct: Let his descendants be wiped out; let their name be erased within a single generation.

verses.kjv: Let the iniquity of his fathers be remembered with the LORD; and let not the sin of his mother be blotted out.
verses.ct: Let the LORD remember the sins of his fathers, and never let his mother's sin be erased.

verses.kjv: Let them be before the LORD continually, that he may cut off the memory of them from the earth.
verses.ct: Let those sins remain always in the LORD's presence, so that he removes every trace of them from the earth.

verses.kjv: Because that he remembered not to shew mercy, but persecuted the poor and needy man, that he might even slay the broken in heart.
verses.ct: Because he never thought to show mercy — instead, he hunted down the poor and needy and tried to kill the brokenhearted.

verses.kjv: As he loved cursing, so let it come unto him: as he delighted not in blessing, so let it be far from him.
verses.ct: He loved to curse others, so let curses fall on him. He took no pleasure in blessing, so let blessing stay far from him.

verses.kjv: As he clothed himself with cursing like as with his garment, so let it come into his bowels like water, and like oil into his bones.
verses.ct: He wore cursing like clothing, so let it soak into his body like water and seep into his bones like oil.

verses.kjv: Let it be unto him as the garment which covereth him, and for a girdle wherewith he is girded continually.
verses.ct: Let it wrap around him like a robe and cling to him like a belt he can never take off.

verses.kjv: Let this be the reward of mine adversaries from the LORD, and of them that speak evil against my soul.
verses.ct: Let this be how the LORD repays my enemies — those who speak evil against my soul.

verses.kjv: But do thou for me, O GOD the Lord, for thy name’s sake: because thy mercy is good, deliver thou me.
verses.ct: But you, LORD God, act on my behalf for the honor of your name. Because your mercy is so good, rescue me.

verses.kjv: For I am poor and needy, and my heart is wounded within me.
verses.ct: I am poor and in need, and my heart is deeply wounded inside me.

verses.kjv: I am gone like the shadow when it declineth: I am tossed up and down as the locust.
verses.ct: I am fading away like an evening shadow; I am shaken off like a locust.

verses.kjv: My knees are weak through fasting; and my flesh faileth of fatness.
verses.ct: My knees buckle from fasting, and my body has grown thin and weak.

verses.kjv: I became also a reproach unto them: when they looked upon me they shaked their heads.
verses.ct: I have become an object of mockery to them — when they see me, they shake their heads in scorn.

verses.kjv: Help me, O LORD my God: O save me according to thy mercy:
verses.ct: Help me, LORD my God! Save me because of your mercy!

verses.kjv: That they may know that this is thy hand; that thou, LORD, hast done it.
verses.ct: Let them recognize that this is your doing — that you, LORD, have accomplished it.

verses.kjv: Let them curse, but bless thou: when they arise, let them be ashamed; but let thy servant rejoice.
verses.ct: They may curse, but you will bless. When they rise up, let them be humiliated, but let your servant celebrate.

verses.kjv: Let mine adversaries be clothed with shame, and let them cover themselves with their own confusion, as with a mantle.
verses.ct: Let my enemies be dressed in shame; let their own disgrace cover them like a cloak.

verses.kjv: I will greatly praise the LORD with my mouth; yea, I will praise him among the multitude.
verses.ct: I will praise the LORD loudly with my mouth; I will praise him in the middle of a great crowd.

verses.kjv: For he shall stand at the right hand of the poor, to save him from those that condemn his soul.
verses.ct: Because he stands beside the needy, ready to save them from those who would condemn their soul.
